main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported in New Orleans, Louisiana, during the period of 29 March to 17 April 1950. One specific sighting involved Mr. and Mrs. Dew Orleans observing an unidentified aerial object on 10 April 1950.
interesting points: The sightings were reported by various EATS units and occurred in the US during the specified period.
Mr. and Mrs. Dew Orleans described the object as egg-shaped, approximately 24 inches in diameter, fiery greenish-purple in color, and moving from west to east at an altitude of about 2,000 feet.
The object was reported to have a buzzing sound resembling the exhaust of a large engine and appeared to leave a cold, silvered, fiery red trail that tapered evenly, approximately 30 feet in length.

Another sighting on 10 April 1950 involved an object that was estimated to be the size of a salad bowl, fiery yellow in color, and moving in a straight line horizontally across the sky at an altitude of approximately 2,000 feet.
The UFO was said to have disappeared suddenly, resembling turning off an electric light, and no projections or maneuvers were observed.
